CTR.Q: What type of chart is this?

VEC.Q: How many series are represented in this stream chart?

SRP.Q: What is the vertical (above/below) relationship of the area representing Operations Staff relative to Human Resources?
SRP.A: Operations Staff is {above} Human Resources in the vertical direction.

SRP.Q: What is the vertical (above/below) relationship of the area representing Human Resources relative to Operations Staff?
SRP.A: Human Resources is {below} Operations Staff in the vertical direction.

VPR.Q: Which series contributes the largest portion to the total training hours?
VPR.A: The series with the largest contribution is {Operations Staff}.

VPR.Q: Which series contributes the smallest portion to the total training hours?
VPR.A: The series with the smallest contribution is {Human Resources}.

EVJ.Q: Which year is Human Resources's maximum Training Hours in the streamgraph?
EVJ.A: Human Resources's maximum Training Hours is in {1987}.

EVJ.Q: Which year is Operations Staff's maximum Training Hours in the streamgraph?
EVJ.A: Operations Staff's maximum Training Hours is in {1989}.

NC.Q: Was the total Training Hours in 1983 higher or lower than in 1989?
NC.A: The total training hours in 1983 was {lower} than in 1989.

NC.Q: Was the total Training Hours in 1972 higher or lower than in 1990?
NC.A: The total training hours in 1972 was {lower} than in 1990.

NC.Q: Between 1971 and 1978, did the total Training Hours experience a larger or smaller change than between 1973 and 1985?
NC.A: The change in total training hours between 1971 and 1978 was {smaller} than between 1973 and 1985.

NC.Q: Was the total Training Hours in 1978 higher or lower than in 1989?
NC.A: The total training hours in 1978 was {lower} than in 1989.

MSR.Q: In this streamgraph, which one held the dominant position for the longest period of time?
MSR.A: {Operations Staff} held the dominant position for the longest period of time.

MSR.Q: In this streamgraph, in which year did Operations Staff and Human Resources first exchange dominant positions?
MSR.A: Operations Staff and Human Resources first exchanged leading positions in {1970}.
